name: Pork Chop and Cheesy Rice Casserole
author: Miss Annette
summary: This is a variation on one of my mother's go-to recipes and gets raves every time I serve it. You can mix and match ingredients depending on what you have on hand. This one will quickly become a favorite in your home; even kids love it! This is a very easy recipe to alter and make your own. The possibilities are endless!
ingredients: 1 (10 ounce) can cream of chicken soup
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Stir chicken broth, rice, cream of chicken soup, and water together with a whisk in the prepared casserole dish until smooth; add Cheddar cheese, season with salt and pepper, and stir
Lie pork chops into the rice mixture in a single layer; season with more black pepper
Bake in preheated oven until rice in the middle of the dish is tender and pork chops are golden brown, about 80 minutes
